column4: Hello. I am trying to install Ubuntu, but in version 7, it stops at 39%, 8 at 49%, and 9.04 beta at 31%. I don't know what to do and I am trying ubuntu to do this. Please help me! Anyone!

Hello. I am trying to install Ubuntu, but in version 7, it stops at 39%, 8 at 49%, and 9.04 beta at 31%. I don't know what to do and I am trying ubuntu to do this. Please help me! Anyone! I know 7 isn't supported, but i tried it.
try running a media check on the burned disk.
also are you receiving any errors? or is it just locking up?
error number 5.
try burning slower and verifying the media.
I think it means that the cd or the reader may be bad.
not necessarily i've had issues burning distros at full speed on certain media for somereason.
I verified it and it was bad. I got it from ubuntu.com ad it was bad. is there anywhere else I could get it?
the iso is bad or the cd you burned?
you can run an md5 check on the iso.  Then you can also run a media check on the disk after its burned assuming hte iso is okay.
Most people have success just burning the image at a slower speed.
I have to eat, be back.
you can type in /msg ubottu <factoid>
